title: 113_s465
content: In this Act, the term "agency" is defined as an Executive agency, an office in the legislative branch, or an office in the judicial branch. The Act cancels the sequestration of budgetary resources for fiscal year 2013 and allows agency heads to implement a flexible sequester. The Act allows agency heads to implement a flexible sequester for the budget in fiscal year 2013, with oversight from the Committees on Appropriations of both Houses. The Act allows agency heads to propose sequester administration to the Committees on Appropriations, who must accept or reject the proposal within 5 days. If both committees accept, the proposal can be implemented; if either rejects, across-the-board cuts will be made in the relevant agency. SEC. 4. DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE FLEXIBILITY IN MANAGEMENT OF MULTIYEAR CONTRACTS. The Secretary of Defense, in consultation with the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, has the authority to manage current multiyear contracts of the Department of Defense to minimize the effects of discretionary spending reductions. Additionally, appropriations or funds for the Department of Defense may be used for certain programs, projects, and activities despite certain limitations. The Department of Defense can use appropriations for specific programs and activities outlined in H.R. 5856 and the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2013. This includes new production, increased production rates, and projects not previously funded. The Department of Defense can enter into contracts for multiyear procurements authorized by the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2013. $372,573,000 from the Shipbuilding and Conversion, Navy funds will be used to cover prior year shipbuilding cost increases. The Department of Defense will transfer and merge funds for various Navy shipbuilding programs: $135,000,000 for CVN Refueling Overhauls, $156,685,000 for LHA Replacement, and $80,888,000 for LPD-17 Amphibious Transport Dock.
